EmptyContainerDepot.description: The depot where the empty container is returned.

CargoGrossWeight.description: The gross weight of the Cargo. Usually mentioned as G.W or GW or Gross Weight, etc..

ContainerNumber.description: The container number associated with the document. They MUST consist of 4 letters followed by 7 digits (e.g., 'CMAU1234567', 'BMOU 575538/3', 'XLXU 1277652'). It can be found in the document as 'Container No.', 'Container Number', 'Cont. No.', 'Cont Nr.', 'Seefrachtcontainer-Nr.', or 'Containernummer'.

ContainerType.description: The size or Type of the container associated with the containerNumber, such as 20ft, 40ft, 40HC, 20DC etc.

EmptyReturnReference.description: The reference number or code for the return of the empty container.

Pin.description: The PIN code associated with the container, often used for security or access purposes.

TareWeight.description: The weight of the empty container itself, without any cargo inside. Usually mentioned as T.W or TW or Tare Weight, etc..

pickUpTerminal.description: The terminal where the container or cargo is picked up.

eta.description: Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) is the expected date when the shipment will arrive at its destination.

etd.description: Estimated Time of Departure (ETD) is the expected date when the shipment will leave the origin port.

portOfDischarge.description: The port where the goods are discharged from the vessel. This is the destination port for the shipment.

portOfLoading.description: The origin port where the goods are loaded onto the vessel. Find information like 'Ladehafen' or 'Port of Loading' in the invoice.

vesselName.description: The name of the vessel carrying the container or shipment

voyage.description: The unique voyage number or identifier assigned to a vesselâ€™s specific journey. This typically corresponds to the scheduled sailing associated with the shipment and can often be found near vessel information on shipping documents. such as voyage, voy. no, voyage-no.
